data.note: According to the presidential decree 5330 from July 2007, Corpoelec is a state-owned company in charge of electricity generation, transmission, distribution and retail in Venezuela. Corpoelec originated from a fusion of 14 regional state-owned companies.
data.name: The power sector has been unbundled (whether privatized or not) into distinct actors for generation, transmission, distribution and retail

data.note: According to the presidential decree 5330 from July 2007, Corpoelec is a state-owned company in charge of electricity generation, transmission, distribution and retail in Venezuela. Corpoelec originated from a fusion of 14 regional state-owned companies.
data.name: There are legally separate private companies at each segment of the power system pre-retail

data.note: According to the presidential decree 5330 from July 2007, Corpoelec is a state-owned company in charge of electricity generation, transmission, distribution and retail in Venezuela. Corpoelec originated from a fusion of 14 regional state-owned companies.
data.name: There is an independent transmission system that dispatches according to market dynamics and is not susceptible to state interference

data.note: Since mid-2014 the 'Banda Verde' has been applied. This subsidizes the residential sector according to its historical standard of consumption, for a number of kWh per region. Above this amount, the rate charged increases by 4.5 times per kWh .
data.name: Retail electricity prices aren't distorted by subsidies

data.note: Corpoelec, which incorporates 14 regional state-owned companies,  is the only organisation allowed to generate eletricity in Venezuela.
data.name: There aren't significant barriers to private sector participation in generation

data.note: Corpoelec is a state-owned company in charge of electricity generation, transmission, distribution and retail in Venezuela.
data.name: Consumers can choose retail suppliers or third-party power marketers in the retail power market

data.note: There isn't a wholesale power market in Venezuela
data.name: There is a functioning competitive wholesale generation market

data.note: Corpoelec, which incorporated 14 regional state-owned companies, is the only company allowed to generate eletricity in Venezuela.
data.name: The generation market has many different actors and is not concentrated in the hands of a few players

data.note: Corpoelec is a state-owned company in charge of eletricity generation, transmission, distribution and retail in Venezuela.
data.name: The supply market has many different actors and is not concentrated in the hands of a few players
